regex.regexparts

Interface REsubexp

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    REsubexpAtom, REsubexpBinary
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    REchar, REconcat, REepsilon, REnull, REstar, REunion, REwildCard

    public interface REsubexp

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      REsubexp derivative(char c)
      Computes the Brzozowski derivative of the regex with respect to character c
      REsubexp getLeft()
      Get the left branch of parse tree.
      int height()
      Height of the parse tree
      boolean matchesEmpty()
      Returns true if the expression matches empty string
      boolean matchesSome()
      Returns true if matches some pattern, returns false if does not match any pattern and is equivalent to null expression
      REsubexp reduce()
      If possible, returns a more simple, but equivalent, expression.

    • Method Detail

      • getLeft

        REsubexp getLeft()
        Get the left branch of parse tree.
        Returns:
        REsubexp which is the left branch

      • matchesEmpty

        boolean matchesEmpty()
        Returns true if the expression matches empty string
        Returns:
        True if matches empty, false otherwise

      • matchesSome

        boolean matchesSome()
        Returns true if matches some pattern, returns false if does not match any pattern and is equivalent to null expression
        Returns:
        true if matches some character, false otherwise

      • derivative

        REsubexp derivative(char c)
        Computes the Brzozowski derivative of the regex with respect to character c
        Parameters:
        c - the character for which derivative is computed with respect to
        Returns:
        derivative of the regex

      • reduce

        REsubexp reduce()
        If possible, returns a more simple, but equivalent, expression.
        Returns:
        the reduced expression

      • height

        int height()
        Height of the parse tree
        Returns:
        height of the tallest subtree + 1
